editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: F-148v: Psalter. F-127v: 151 Psalms of David. The word for God is unrubricated. In the margins of many psalms, there are calu calculation marks (looking like a ligature fusing ዝ and የ with number lines above) marking ten lines. The spiritual meanings of the Hebrew letters are not given in the base hand (which has only the name of the letter), but a later hand has added the meanings of the new common system. Psalm 151 is the short version. F-141v: Biblical Canticles. The fourth biblical canticle is "Song of Hana, mother of Samuel. F-148v: Song of Songs, common version. F-156v: Praises of Mary, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (149r), Tuesday (149v), Wednesday (150v), Thursday (152r), Friday (153v), Saturday (154v), Sunday (155v). Varia: : the contents of the manuscript, written in faint pencil. : Prayer in Ge'ez, only partially legible, apparently for the healing of a wound. The same prayer is found upside down on . : Note in Amharic, mostly illegible. Also upside down on . : Beginning of a recipe for a medical ointment in Ge'ez. Also upside down on . : The name of the owner has been deleted; it may have been Yosef. (information includes material from Macomber, Catalogue).
